info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 12:41PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CENTRE... NORTHEASTERN JUNIATA...SNYDER...UNION...NORTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND... EASTERN PERRY AND SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM EDT... At 1240 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles southwest of Mifflinburg to 17 miles east of Lewistown to 18 miles northwest of Enola to 15 miles northwest of Mechanicsburg to Carlisle. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Weikert, Snyder-Middleswart State Park and McClure around 1245 PM EDT. Laurelton Center, Beaver Springs and Troxelville around 1250 PM EDT. R.B. Winter State Park, Richfield and Carroll around 1255 PM EDT. Mifflinburg, Fremont and Paxtonville around 100 PM EDT. Sand Bridge State Park, Forest Hill and Mount Pleasant Mills around 105 PM EDT. Middleburg, Spruce Run Reservoir and Vicksburg around 110 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Beavertown, Liverpool, Millerstown, Hartleton and New Berlin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
